p:
In addition to the endosome-mediated entry pathway, host proteases also play critical roles in the nonendosomal entry of coronaviruses.
5 Host proteases such as the transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) and TMPRSS11D can cleave the S protein at the S1/S2 cleavage site ( Figure 2 ) to prime and activate the S protein for membrane fusion during the nonendosomal pathway.
18 A recent study also confirms that TMPRSS2 expressing VeroE6 cells are highly susceptible to SARS-CoV-2 infection, highlighting the importance of TMPRSS2 in the replication cycle.
19
